intro: Disterigma dissimile, commonly known as the narrow-leaf disterigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, often in well-drained soils. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
